title: Olaf Lies
text:
Olaf Lies (born 8 May 1967) is a German politician of the <a href="Social%20Democratic%20Party%20of%20Germany">Social Democratic Party</a> (SPD). He was first elected to the <a href="Landtag%20of%20Lower%20Saxony">Landtag of Lower Saxony</a> in 2008.
Political career.
Lies joined the <a href="Social%20Democratic%20Party%20of%20Germany">Social Democratic Party</a> in 2002. In the <a href="2008%20Lower%20Saxony%20state%20election">2008 state elections</a> he became member of the <a href="Landtag%20of%20Lower%20Saxony">Landtag of Lower Saxony</a>. He was leader of his party in <a href="Lower%20Saxony">Lower Saxony</a> from 2010 to 2012.
Minister-President <a href="Stephan%20Weil">Stephan Weil</a> of Lower Saxony appointed Lies to the position of State Minister for Economics, Labour and Transport in 2013 and later to State Minister for Environment, Energy, Building, and Climate Protection in his <a href="Cabinet%20Weil%20II">cabinet</a>.
In the negotiations to form a <a href="coalition%20government">coalition government</a> under the leadership of <a href="Chancellor%20of%20Germany">Chancellor</a> <a href="Angela%20Merkel">Angela Merkel</a> following the <a href="2017%20German%20federal%20election">2017 federal elections</a>, Lies was part of the working group on energy, climate protection and the environment, led by <a href="Armin%20Laschet">Armin Laschet</a>, <a href="Georg%20N%C3%BC%C3%9Flein">Georg Nüßlein</a> and <a href="Barbara%20Hendricks%20%28politician%29">Barbara Hendricks</a>.
In the negotiations to form a so-called <a href="traffic%20light%20coalition">traffic light coalition</a> of the SPD, the <a href="Alliance%2090/The%20Greens">Green Party</a> and the <a href="Free%20Democratic%20Party%20%28Germany%29">Free Democratic Party</a> (FDP) following the <a href="2021%20German%20federal%20election">2021 federal elections</a>, Lies was part of his party's delegation in the working group on agriculture and nutrition, co-chaired by <a href="Till%20Backhaus">Till Backhaus</a>, <a href="Renate%20K%C3%BCnast">Renate Künast</a> and <a href="Carina%20Konrad">Carina Konrad</a>.
Lies was nominated by his party as delegate to the <a href="Federal%20Convention%20%28Germany%29">Federal Convention</a> for the purpose of electing the <a href="President%20of%20Germany">President of Germany</a> in <a href="2022%20German%20presidential%20election">2022</a>.
